topics.body:
In random news today I found out why so many people find corsets uncomfortable; cause 99% of people fasten it wrong.

You're supposed to tighten the string from the middle not from the top.  If you tighten it from the top it will push against your ribs and make you feel like throwing up.  The correct way of tightening them is to tie a knot at the ends of the string then from the middle of your back pull it outwards then do a butterfly knot.

The proper way of doing it doesn't make me feel sick or anything.

Tl:dr; if you feel sick while wearing a corset you're tightening it wrong.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557fa69c6368725e47000a94#post_557fa69c6368725e47000a94
It's a bit more complex than that. Originally, it wasn't supposed to have any IP, since they made the gameplay first and assigned the IP later. As is typical for Nintendo games and probably the reason why there are so many different Mario games (the IP itself doesn't really matter that much and an already existing one is safer than something completely new).

The decision to make it a Mario game came during the development, like the decision to make it something new instead.
